channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Two Upstart Search Engines Are Teaming Up to Take on Google
item.description: Generative AI and new rules targeting tech giants are giving Ecosia and Qwant fuel to challenge Google and Microsoft and develop a web index for Europ...

item.title: Fleek, a marketplace for wholesale second-hand clothes, sews up $20M
item.description: Fleek, an online marketplace that connects second-hand clothing wholesalers with those who sell it at retail, has raised a $20.4 million Series A. © 2...

item.title: Agicap secures $48 million for its cash flow management platform
item.description: On average, Agicap’s clients manage 15 different bank accounts each. So the chief financial officers (CFOs) working for these companies sometimes stru...

item.title: Quantune joins quest for the holy grail of non-invasive glucose monitoring
item.description: Berlin-based Quantune is trying to shrink laser spectrometers so that you can wear one on your wrist, and it just raised $9M to do it. © 2024 TechCrun...

item.title: Branch’s Early Black Friday Sale Has Deals on Our Top Office Chairs
item.description: Our top office chair and standing desk recommendations are on sale through December 2.

item.title: Signal gets new video call features, making it a viable alternative to Zoom, Meet and Teams
item.description: Privacy-focused messaging app Signal is adding new features for video calls, including links, reactions and a calls tab, in a bid to pose as an altern...

item.title: The Real Problem With Banning Masks at Protests
item.description: Privacy advocates worry banning masks at protests will encourage harassment, while cops' high-tech tools render the rules unnecessary.

item.title: The WIRED Guide to Protecting Yourself From Government Surveillance
item.description: Donald Trump has vowed to deport millions and jail his enemies. To carry out that agenda, his administration will exploit America’s digital surveillan...

item.title: SoftBank Vision Fund co-CEO Misra to leave firm
item.description: SoftBank said the co-CEO of Vision Fund, Rajeev Misra, will soon step down from his leadership roles at the firm’s flagship technology investment vehi...

item.title: COP29 Begins With Climate Finance, Absent Leaders, and Trump Looming Large
item.description: The annual UN climate summit has kicked off in Baku, Azerbaijan, with lofty goals, but many global leaders missing.
